item.title: Expectation-Maximization Algorithm
item.description: From some on-line article, it is interesting that we can consider EM algorithm as some Chinese Kungfu manuals and it contains 9 levels of perspectives. With such metaphor, I can feel how this method powerful it is. Now, I want to share my view with you. Introduction to the EM algorithm Expectation-Maximization (EM) algorithm is an important method to solve the maximum likelihood problem with latent variables in statistics. It is widely used in Machine Learning because it can simplify many difficult problems.

item.title: Coordinate Descent Algorithm
item.description: Coordinate Descent Framework At the begining of this section, we start to discuss three different types of function. Given convex, differentiable function \(f: \mathbb{R}^n \to \mathbb{R}\), we know \(f(x+\delta \cdot e_i)\geq f(x)\) for all \(\delta\) because \(\nabla f(x) = (\frac{\partial f}{\partial x_1}(x),\dots,\frac{\partial f}{\partial x_n}(x)) = 0\). Here, \(e_i = (0,\dots,1,\dots,0) \in \mathbb{R}^n\), the \(i\)th standard basis vactor. Figure1. Convex and differential function \(f\) Given convex but not differentiable function \(f\), we can not found a global minimizer.
